entry.title: Vivian Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Vivian Smith (pictured) was the first black student to earn a bachelor's degree in English from the University of Northern Iowa?

entry.title: Book of Common Prayer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that use of the 1604 Book of Common Prayer was authorized by the king of England, but later outlawed by Parliament?

entry.title: Esra Kiraz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Turkish world- and European-champion armwrestler Esra Kiraz used to carry cement bags at construction sites where her father worked?

entry.title: Compaq Deskpro 386 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the release of the Compaq Deskpro 386 marked the first time a company other than IBM revised a major component of their PC standard?

entry.title: Quentin Oliver Lee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Quentin Oliver Lee landed a title role in Gershwin's Porgy and Bess on Broadway after a casting agent spotted him singing in a subway station?

entry.title: Citizen Erased (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Citizen Erased" was Muse's first song to include a seven-string guitar?

entry.title: James Oleske (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that pediatrician James Oleske was a pioneer in identifying that HIV/AIDS could be a disease in children?

entry.title: Pablo Eskobear (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a bear ate 75 pounds (34 kg) of cocaine in 1985, and was nicknamed Pablo Eskobear?
